agency: Department of Game and Inland Fisheries

species.name: White Catfish
species.identification: Catfish family. One of the bullhead catfishes. Average 8 to 18 inches, rarely 20. Has a moderately forked tail, a stocky body with its upper jaw extending slightly beyond lower. Color is basically bluegray above, fading to gray on its sides with a white underside. Occasionally mottled light gray on its sides.

best_fishing.description: Tidal rivers such as the Potomac, Rappahannock, James, and York and numerous lakes in southeast and central Virginia.

fishing_techniques: Many of the same methods used for other catfish.\nWorms, minnows, scented baits, fished on or near the bottom.
